title: 2012 EULAR/ACR Classification Criteria for Polymyalgia Rheumatica
description: Classifies polymyalgia rheumatica by expert consensus recommendations using clinical and optionally ultrasonographic criteria

parameters.name: hip_pain_limited_rom
parameters.description: Hip pain or limited range of motion

parameters.name: rf_or_acpa
parameters.description: Rheumatoid factor (RF) or anti-citrullinated peptide antibody (ACPA)

parameters.name: ultrasound_shoulder_hip
parameters.description: At least one shoulder with specific findings and one hip with synovitis (ultrasound)

ranges.description: Does not classify as PMR (without ultrasound)
ranges.interpretation: Score below the cutoff point for classification as polymyalgia rheumatica. Consider alternative diagnoses.
Score ≥4 points classifies as polymyalgia rheumatica by EULAR/ACR 2012 criteria. Sensitivity 72%, specificity 65%.

ranges.description: Does not classify as PMR (with ultrasound)
ranges.interpretation: Score below the cutoff point for classification as polymyalgia rheumatica with ultrasonography. Consider alternative diagnoses.
Score ≥5 points classifies as polymyalgia rheumatica by EULAR/ACR 2012 criteria with ultrasound. Sensitivity 71%, specificity 70%.

references: Dasgupta B, Cimmino MA, Maradit-Kremers H, et al. 2012 provisional classification criteria for polymyalgia rheumatica: a European League Against Rheumatism/American College of Rheumatology collaborative initiative. Ann Rheum Dis. 2012;71(4):484-92.
Mackie SL, Koduri G, Hill CL, et al. Accuracy of musculoskeletal imaging for the diagnosis of polymyalgia rheumatica: systematic review. RMD Open. 2015;1(1):e000100.
formula: Score = Morning stiffness (0-2) + Hip pain/limited ROM (0-1) + Absence RF/ACPA (0-2) + Absence pain other joints (0-1) + Shoulder/hip ultrasound (0-1) + Both shoulders ultrasound (0-1)
notes: Apply only to patients ≥50 years with bilateral shoulder pain and abnormal ESR and/or CRP
These criteria are for research classification, not for individual diagnosis
Lower specificity for distinguishing PMR from seronegative rheumatoid arthritis
Specific ultrasonographic findings include subdeltoid and/or bicipital bursitis and/or glenohumeral synovitis
